title: 'When my twin lost his memory, I lied to him about abuse in our childhood'
text:
Alex Lewis’s earliest memory is from when he was 18. It is August 1982 and he is in Guildford Hospital, where he has been in a coma with severe trauma to the head following a motorcycle accident. He opens his eyes blearily and sees his identical twin brother: “Hello, Marcus,” he says.

Marcus doesn’t feel relief; there’s no need, because he was never worried Alex wouldn’t recover. “I felt him have the accident,” says Marcus. “I had complete, 100 per cent knowledge that he was going to wake up and be fine.”

Alex survived the accident, but his memory didn’t – he searched for his own name, and realised he didn’t know anything about himself or his childhood.
